result.execSummary:
The defendant Baakia Maurisa Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Submit DNA sample; pay DNA surcharge. Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

- No Contact with any Kohl's Stores.
- No Contact with Brooklyn H.
- Complete HSED.
- Maintain employment.
- Perform 30 hours of community service.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Baakia Maurisa Clark in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status of counsel, new attorney present for today's proceedings.  

Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Baakia Maurisa Clark in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 08-06-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Baakia Maurisa Clark
Current: 2335 North 1st Street Apt 8, Milwaukee, WI 53212   (Effective: 06-25-2015)
Prior: 2335 North 1st Street Apt 8, Milwaukee, WI 53212
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with any Kohl's store and Brooklyn H. or her residence or place of employment

Defendant Baakia Maurisa Clark in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br.24.vb

Defendant Baakia Maurisa Clark not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
She called the court on 6-24-2015, to inform us that she is having surgery on Friday in the A.M. Rescheduled for Thursday 6-25-2015, at 1:30 pm. I informed her that if she fails to appear a WARRANT will be issued for her arrest.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/26/15 @ 1:30pm
